q_ch: 我是Advanced Sewers，请将属于我的所有2024年5月1日-2024年5月30日之间开始的裁剪任务转给Premier Sewers。
q_en: I am an Advanced Sewer. Please transfer all cutting tasks that started between May 1, 2024, and May 30, 2024, to Premier Sewers.

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Advanced Sewer';
steps.description: Retrieve the ID of the customer "Advanced Sewer"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM working_group WHERE name = 'cutting tasks';
steps.description: Retrieve the ID of the working group "cutting tasks"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Premier Sewers';
steps.description: Retrieve the ID of the customer "Premier Sewers"

steps.sql: ['UPDATE cutting_tasks SET working_group_id = '<premier_sewers_id>' WHERE start_time BETWEEN '2024-05-01' AND '2024-05-30' AND working_group_id = '<cutting_tasks_id>';']
steps.description: Update the working group ID for cutting tasks that started between May 1, 2024, and May 30, 2024, to the ID of "Premier Sewers"
steps.results: (1064, "You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '['UPDATE cutting_tasks SET working_group_id = '<premier_sewers_id>' WHERE start_' at line 1")

response:
Hey there! 😄

I see you're looking to transfer some tasks from "Advanced Sewer" to "Premier Sewers" that started between May 1, 2024, and May 30, 2024. Let me help you with that!

Here's the plan:
| Task Description | Status |
|------------------|--------|
| Retrieve the ID of the customer "Advanced Sewer" | No results found. |
| Retrieve the ID of the working group "cutting tasks" | No results found. |
| Retrieve the ID of the customer "Premier Sewers" | No results found. |
| Update the working group ID for cutting tasks to "Premier Sewers" | Error: You have an error in your SQL syntax. |

It seems like we encountered a small hiccup with the SQL syntax. Don't worry, I'll work on fixing that for you! Feel free to ask if you have any more questions. 😊
